headline: Nvidia, Salesforce, & HP earnings, Fed minutes: What to watch
summary: Wednesday, May 28, will be a big one for Wall Street. Nvidia (NVDA) will report its first quarter earnings after the market close. Salesforce (CRM), HP (HPQ), and Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF) are also set to report their quarterly results. Also in focus will be the minutes from the FOMC meeting earlier this month. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: DJT & bitcoin, Wingstop upgrade, Salesforce–Informatica deal
summary: Market Domination co-host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) stock falls as the company announces plans to build one of the largest bitcoin (BTC-USD) treasuries. Wingstop (WING) stock rises after Truist upgraded the stock to Buy from Hold and raised its price target to $400 from $274. Meanwhile, Informatica (INFA) also pops as Salesforce (CRM) unveils an $8 billion acquisition to boost its data capabilities. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Salesforce acquires Informatica for $8 billion
summary: Salesforce has acquired cloud data management firm Informatica in an $8 billion equity deal, marking a major move in its push to strengthen its AI and data infrastructure capabilities. The announcement, made Tuesday, comes about a year after early rumors of the acquisition sent both companies’ stock prices sliding. At the time, Informatica denied it was for sale, but a lot can change in a year. Under the terms of the deal, Salesforce will pay $25 in cash per share for Informatica’s Class A and C

headline: Salesforce Strikes $8 Billion Deal for Informatica
summary: Salesforce  struck a roughly $8 billion deal for data-management software firm  Informatica  in a bid to bolster its capabilities in the arms race to put artificial intelligence to work.  Salesforce agreed to pay $25 a share for Informatica, the companies announced Tuesday, confirming an earlier report from The Wall Street Journal.  The process was competitive, with Salesforce beating out multiple other strategic and private-equity suitors, including Cloud Software Group (formerly Citrix Systems) and Thoma Bravo, according to people familiar with the matter.

raw.headline: Salesforce Strikes $8 Billion Deal for Informatica
raw.summary: Salesforce  struck a roughly $8 billion deal for data-management software firm  Informatica  in a bid to bolster its capabilities in the arms race to put artificial intelligence to work.  Salesforce agreed to pay $25 a share for Informatica, the companies announced Tuesday, confirming an earlier report from The Wall Street Journal.  The process was competitive, with Salesforce beating out multiple other strategic and private-equity suitors, including Cloud Software Group (formerly Citrix Systems) and Thoma Bravo, according to people familiar with the matter.

headline: Salesforce Buys Informatica for About $8B After Failed Attempt Last Year

headline: Salesforce to Buy Informatica for $25 a Share, $8 Billion in Equity Value
summary: Salesforce  signed a definitive agreement to acquire cloud data management company  Informatica  for $25 a share in a deal worth $8 billion in equity value.  Salesforce  stock was up 0.6% after the news broke Tuesday.  Shares of the software giant declined 3.6% to $273.13 on Friday after The Wall Street Journal reported that talks between the two companies were advancing.

Salesforce  stock was up 0.6% after the news broke Tuesday.  Shares of the software giant declined 3.6% to $273.13 on Friday after The Wall Street Journal reported that talks between the two companies were advancing.
